skillTree.localised_description: Ulthuan's Great Eagles are the firm allies of the Elves, fighting their causes since the coming of Chaos.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: The eldest, most powerful Dragons can destroy entire units with a molten blast of their white-hot breath.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: The High Elves possess a natural skill that far outstrips the prowess of ordinary mortals.
With precise applications of unmaking, any threat may be rendered null and void in turn.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

skillTree.localised_description: Mere talent alone is not enough, one must be truly gifted to be chosen to study at the Tower of Hoeth.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -10% for all spells

skillTree.localised_description: The supporters of Hoeth bask in their patron's generosity, for it was he who gifted the Elves with much of their revered knowledge.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5% for Swordmasters of Hoeth units
	(Lord's army)

Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
	(own army)

Leadership: +5 for Swordmasters of Hoeth units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Torinubar has honed the art of Kineticism, also called "Minaith Qhaysh", a school of High Magic consisting on focusing the essence of the True Magic into kinetic energies, used for both defensive and offensive purposes.
As expected of a veteran member of the order of the White Tower, and even if his speciality is the Kineticist style ,Torinubar wields the lore of Qhaysh expertly.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +15
	(armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: "Forces of Qhaysh, hear the request of your most-studious adept: flow through me according to my will!"
Using his mastery over Qhaysh and his mastery of the Kineticist style, Torinubar can use waves of True Magic energy to disrupt the concentration of enemy spellcasters.

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: -15
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Years of ruling over an important Asur trading post far from the High Elven metropolis has given Torinubar an unique insight on trade and resource management.
These elite Asur swordsmen have sworn to defend the Gates of Calith from all who threaten them, and Torinubar will die with them

effects.description:
Melee attack: +6 for Calith Gatekeepers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +12 for Calith Gatekeepers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: One of Torinubar's unique techniques consist on perfectly weaving and compressing a ball of True Magic and then releasing it's energies in a powerful kinetic shockwave, pushing all his foes away from him.

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Turning an untrained bunch of regular citizens into effective fighting units requires a special kind of talent, and oodles of patience.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

effects.description: Window to the East: Engage in transit trade by buying and selling Eastern commodities and Western commodities which can also be used to bolster troops
Whenever you complete a convoy journey to an order faction's settlements, you'll get an entrepot building

backgroundSkills.localised_name: Mage Lord of the Gates of Calith
backgroundSkills.localised_description: Torinubar has ruled over the Gates of Calith for centuries now in the name of the Phoenix Kings of Ulthuan, as such, he has become accustomed to managing the trade routes that pass through them.

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle
